alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 11:29AM EDT until April 05 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River from Bedford to Shoals. White River from Elliston to Hazleton. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Rivervale. White River at Edwardsport. .Widespread lowland flooding continues along the White River at Elliston to all points downstream...and along the East Fork White River from near Bedford to all points downstream. Moderate flooding has begun at Petersburg...and will continue along the lower White River through Sunday. The crest on the White River will continue along the Knox...Daviess County line through Friday. Flooding will likely last through Friday along Greene County portions of the White River...and through next week along lower portions of the White River. The crest on the East Fork White River will pass Bedford later today with minor flooding continuing for areas downstream through early next week. Rain going into this weekend may extend flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River near Rivervale. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Extensive river flooding in progress. Residential areas near the river begin to flood. The county bridge locally known as the Buddha bypass bridge becomes inaccessible. Several local roads are flooded including Duncan Rd/Tunnelton Rd, Fort Ritner at the underpass and post office, Old Buddha Rd, Tunnelton Rd at the railroad crossing and West Sparksville Bridge Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 28.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EDT Thursday was 29.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Tuesday afternoon and continue falling to 10.6 feet Sunday, April 09. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
